definition[0]: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free
example[0]: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
definition[1]: a printed form, used when you order something, enter a competition etc
example[1]: To order, fill in the coupon on page 154.
definition[2]: a small piece of paper attached to certain types of bond, that you tear off and hand in so as to receive interest
example[2]: The frequency of coupon payments can differ between bonds; for example, some bonds pay coupons quarterly, others pay coupons annually.
definition[3]: the rate of interest paid on bonds
example[3]: a new two-year bond with a 10% coupon
example[4]: The high coupon is there to compensate high risk.
definition[4]: a printed piece of paper given to customers by the seller of a product, allowing the customer to pay less than usual for the product when they next buy it, or to get a free gift
definition[5]: a printed piece of paper given to people by the government, allowing them to buy a particular product or get something for free, usually during a war
